Description: Necklace (?): comprising seventy-seven cornelian beads, including spherical, ellipsoid, long cylinder, long and standard truncated convex bicone and lenticular forms. The lenticular beads, although of varying sizes, are all flattened ovals. Unstrung.
Dimensions: Length: 1.88 centimetres (bead marked with identification numbers)
Thickness: 0.52 centimetres (bead marked with identification numbers)
Width: 1.52 centimetres (bead marked with identification numbers)
Curator's comments: Bibliography: C. M. Firth, ‘Archaeological Survey of Nubia, 1910-11’ (Cairo, 1927), pl. 28a, 8: Middle Kingdom.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (502)
